refsect1.title: Object Hierarchy
refsect1.screen: GEnum ╰── GDriveStartStopType GFlags ╰── GDriveStartFlags GInterface ╰── GDrive

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GDrive - this represent a piece of hardware connected to the machine. It's generally only created for removable hardware or hardware with removable media.

GDrive is a container class for GVolume objects that stem from the same piece of media. As such, GDrive abstracts a drive with (or without) removable media and provides operations for querying whether media is available, determining whether media change is automatically detected and ejecting the media.

If the GDrive reports that media isn't automatically detected, one can poll for media; typically one should not do this periodically as a poll for media operation is potententially expensive and may spin up the drive creating noise.

GDrive supports starting and stopping drives with authentication support for the former. This can be used to support a diverse set of use cases including connecting/disconnecting iSCSI devices, powering down external disk enclosures and starting/stopping multi-disk devices such as RAID devices. Note that the actual semantics and side-effects of starting/stopping a GDrive may vary according to implementation. To choose the correct verbs in e.g. a file manager, use g_drive_get_start_stop_type().
For porting from GnomeVFS note that there is no equivalent of GDrive in that API.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a string containing drive 's name. The returned string should be freed when no longer needed.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: GIcon for the drive . Free the returned object with g_object_unref().

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: symbolic GIcon for the drive . Free the returned object with g_object_unref().

refsect2.title: g_drive_has_volumes ()
refsect2.para: Check if drive has any mountable volumes.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the drive contains volumes, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_drive_get_volumes ()
refsect2.para: Get a list of mountable volumes for drive .
The returned list should be freed with g_list_free(), after its elements have been unreffed with g_object_unref().

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: GList containing any GVolume objects on the given drive .

refsect2.title: g_drive_can_eject ()
refsect2.para: Checks if a drive can be ejected.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the drive can be ejected, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_drive_get_start_stop_type ()
refsect2.para: Gets a hint about how a drive can be started/stopped.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A value from the GDriveStartStopType enumeration.

refsect2.title: g_drive_can_start ()
refsect2.para: Checks if a drive can be started.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the drive can be started, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_drive_can_start_degraded ()
refsect2.para: Checks if a drive can be started degraded.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the drive can be started degraded, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_drive_can_stop ()
refsect2.para: Checks if a drive can be stopped.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the drive can be stopped, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_drive_can_poll_for_media ()
refsect2.para: Checks if a drive can be polled for media changes.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the drive can be polled for media changes, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_drive_poll_for_media ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_drive_poll_for_media (GDrive *drive, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Asynchronously polls drive to see if media has been inserted or removed.
When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call g_drive_poll_for_media_finish() to obtain the result of the operation.

entry.para: optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.
user data to pass to callback

refsect2.title: g_drive_poll_for_media_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes an operation started with g_drive_poll_for_media() on a drive.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the drive has been poll_for_mediaed successfully, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_drive_has_media ()
refsect2.para: Checks if the drive has media. Note that the OS may not be polling the drive for media changes; see g_drive_is_media_check_automatic() for more details.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if drive has media, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_drive_is_media_check_automatic ()
refsect2.para: Checks if drive is capabable of automatically detecting media changes.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the drive is capabable of automatically detecting media changes, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_drive_is_removable ()
refsect2.para: Checks if the GDrive and/or its media is considered removable by the user. See g_drive_is_media_removable().

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if drive and/or its media is considered removable, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_drive_is_media_removable ()
refsect2.para: Checks if the drive supports removable media.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if drive supports removable media, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_drive_eject ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_drive_eject (GDrive *drive, GMountUnmountFlags flags, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);

warning.para: g_drive_eject has been deprecated since version 2.22 and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call g_drive_eject_finish() to obtain the result of the operation.

entry.para: flags affecting the unmount if required for eject
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.
user data to pass to callback

warning.para: g_drive_eject_finish has been deprecated since version 2.22 and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the drive has been ejected successfully, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_drive_eject_with_operation ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_drive_eject_with_operation (GDrive *drive, GMountUnmountFlags flags, GMountOperation *mount_operation, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para:
Ejects a drive. This is an asynchronous operation, and is finished by calling g_drive_eject_with_operation_finish() with the drive
and GAsyncResult data returned in the callback .

entry.para: flags affecting the unmount if required for eject
a GMountOperation or NULL to avoid user interaction.
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect2.title: g_drive_eject_with_operation_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes ejecting a drive. If any errors occurred during the operation, error will be set to contain the errors and FALSE will be returned.

entry.para: a GError location to store the error occurring, or NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the drive was successfully ejected. FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_drive_start ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_drive_start (GDrive *drive, GDriveStartFlags flags, GMountOperation *mount_operation, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call g_drive_start_finish() to obtain the result of the operation.

entry.para: a GMountOperation or NULL to avoid user interaction.
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.
user data to pass to callback

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the drive has been started successfully, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_drive_stop ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_drive_stop (GDrive *drive, GMountUnmountFlags flags, GMountOperation *mount_operation, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call g_drive_stop_finish() to obtain the result of the operation.

entry.para: flags affecting the unmount if required for stopping.
a GMountOperation or NULL to avoid user interaction.
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.
user data to pass to callback

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the drive has been stopped successfully, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_drive_enumerate_identifiers ()
refsect2.para: Gets the kinds of identifiers that drive has. Use g_drive_get_identifier() to obtain the identifiers themselves.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a NULL-terminated array of strings containing kinds of identifiers. Use g_strfreev() to free.

refsect2.title: g_drive_get_identifier ()
refsect2.para: Gets the identifier of the given kind for drive . The only identifier currently available is G_DRIVE_IDENTIFIER_KIND_UNIX_DEVICE.

entry.para: the kind of identifier to return

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a newly allocated string containing the requested identifier, or NULL if the GDrive doesn't have this kind of identifier.

refsect2.title: g_drive_get_sort_key ()
refsect2.para: Gets the sort key for drive , if any.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: Sorting key for drive or NULL if no such key is available.

refsect2.title: struct GDriveIface

entry.para: Signal emitted when the drive is changed.
The removed signal that is emitted when the GDrive have been disconnected. If the recipient is holding references to the object they should release them so the object can be finalized.
Signal emitted when the physical eject button (if any) of a drive have been pressed.
Returns the name for the given GDrive.
Returns a GIcon for the given GDrive.
Returns TRUE if the GDrive has mountable volumes.
Returns a list GList of GVolume for the GDrive.
Returns TRUE if the GDrive supports removal and insertion of media.
Returns TRUE if the GDrive has media inserted.
Returns TRUE if the GDrive is capabable of automatically detecting media changes.
Returns TRUE if the GDrive can eject media.
Returns TRUE if the GDrive is capable of manually polling for media change.
Poll for media insertion/removal on a GDrive.
Returns the identifier of the given kind, or NULL if the GDrive doesn't have one.
Returns an array strings listing the kinds of identifiers which the GDrive has.
Gets a GDriveStartStopType with details about starting/stopping the drive. Since 2.22.
Returns TRUE if a GDrive can be started. Since 2.22.
Returns TRUE if a GDrive can be started degraded. Since 2.22.
Returns TRUE if a GDrive can be stopped. Since 2.22.
Signal emitted when the physical stop button (if any) of a drive have been pressed. Since 2.22.
Starts ejecting a GDrive using a GMountOperation. Since 2.22.
Finishes an eject operation using a GMountOperation. Since 2.22.
Gets a key used for sorting GDrive instances or NULL if no such key exists. Since 2.32.
Returns a symbolic GIcon for the given GDrive. Since 2.34.
Returns TRUE if the GDrive and/or its media is considered removable by the user. Since 2.50.

refsect2.title: enum GDriveStartFlags
refsect2.para: Flags used when starting a drive.

refsect2.title: enum GDriveStartStopType
refsect2.para: Enumeration describing how a drive can be started/stopped.

entry.para: Unknown or drive doesn't support start/stop.
The stop method will physically shut down the drive and e.g. power down the port the drive is attached to.
The start/stop methods are used for connecting/disconnect to the drive over the network.
The start/stop methods will assemble/disassemble a virtual drive from several physical drives.
The start/stop methods will unlock/lock the disk (for example using the ATA <quote>SECURITY UNLOCK DEVICE</quote> command)

refsect2.title: G_DRIVE_IDENTIFIER_KIND_UNIX_DEVICE
refsect2.para: The string used to obtain a Unix device path with g_drive_get_identifier().

refsect2.title: The changed signal
refsect2.para: Emitted when the drive's state has changed.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The disconnected signal
refsect2.para: This signal is emitted when the GDrive have been disconnected. If the recipient is holding references to the object they should release them so the object can be finalized.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The eject-button signal
refsect2.para: Emitted when the physical eject button (if any) of a drive has been pressed.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The stop-button signal
refsect2.para: Emitted when the physical stop button (if any) of a drive has been pressed.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.
